UsageReport.Description: Show all the valid usages for a command

CommandReport.Name: editor
CommandReport.Description: Choose or display the path to the editor that you wish fubu.exe to use when opening files

UsageReport.Description: Choose or display the path to the editor that you wish fubu.exe to use when opening files

CommandReport.Name: add
CommandReport.Description: Adds new projects to an existing solution

ArgumentReport.Name: projectname
ArgumentReport.Description: The name of the new project

ArgumentReport.Name: profile
ArgumentReport.Description: Project profile. Use the --list flag to see the valid options

FlagReport.Description: Specify the solution file name if there is more than one in this code tree
Used in many templates as a prefix for generted classes
Do not generate a matching testing project. Boo!
List all the possible project types and their valid options
Extra options for the new application
Specify the .Net version 'v4.0' or 'v4.5'

CommandReport.Name: enhance
CommandReport.Description: Enhances an existing project by applying infrastructure templates to an existing project

ArgumentReport.Name: project
ArgumentReport.Description: Name of the project to enhance

FlagReport.Description: List all the valid options

UsageReport.Description: Enhances an existing project by applying infrastructure templates to an existing project

CommandReport.Name: quickstart
CommandReport.Description: Stand up a full FubuMVC application structure with the full idiomatic stack

UsageReport.Description: Stand up a full FubuMVC application structure with the full idiomatic stack

CommandReport.Name: view
CommandReport.Description: Creates and attaches a view model/view pair to the project in the current folder

ArgumentReport.Name: name
ArgumentReport.Description: Name of the view and matching model without file extension

FlagReport.Description: If specified, will make this actionless view applied to the given url pattern
open the view model and view after generation

UsageReport.Description: Creates and attaches a view model/view pair to the project in the current folder

CommandReport.Name: mode
CommandReport.Description: Reads and sets the 'FubuMode' environment variable

FlagReport.Description: Named mode for modes other than Development
Sets the environment variable to FubuMode=Development
Clears the 'FubuMode' environment variable

UsageReport.Description: Reads and sets the 'FubuMode' environment variable

CommandReport.Name: new
CommandReport.Description: Lays out and creates a new code tree with the idiomatic fubu project layout

ArgumentReport.Name: solutionname
ArgumentReport.Description: Name of the solution and the root folder without an extension

ArgumentReport.Name: profile
ArgumentReport.Description: Project profile. Use the --list flag to see the valid options

FlagReport.Description: List all the possible project types and their valid options
Only list a preview of the template plan, but do not execute the plan
Use edge nugets from the Fubu TeamCity feed. Equivalent to --ripple Edge
Use floating edge nugets from the Fubu TeamCity feed. Equivalent to --ripple FloatingEdge
Choose a ripple configuration for only public Nuget feeds, including the Fubu TeamCity feed, or 'floating' on the Fubu edge
Used in many templates as a prefix for generated classes
Clean out any existing contents of the target folder before running the templates
Do not generate a matching testing project. Boo!
Visual Studio version. 'VS2012' is the default. Options are 'VS2010', 'VS2012', or 'VS2013'
Specify the .Net version 'v4.0' or 'v4.5'
Ignore the presence of existing files
Extra options for the new application

CommandReport.Name: restart
CommandReport.Description: Restarts a web application by 'touching' the web.config file

ArgumentReport.Name: appfolder
ArgumentReport.Description: Physical folder (or valid alias) of the web application

UsageReport.Description: Restarts a web application by 'touching' the web.config file

CommandReport.Name: run
CommandReport.Description: Run a fubumvc application hosted in Katana

FlagReport.Description: If you are running a class library, sets the preference for the profile to load. As in bin/[BuildFlag]. Default is debug
IP Port. Default is 5500
Specific name of an IApplicationSource class that builds this application
If set, overrides the name of the configuration file for the FubuMVC application AppDomain to use
Overrides the directory that is the physical path of the running fubumvc application
Start the default browser to the home page of this application
Open a 'watched' browser with WebDriver to refresh the page on content or application recycles
Browser to use in watched. Default is Firefox because it's more stable.
Unless this flag is set, the fubumvc application will run in Development mode

UsageReport.Description: Run a fubumvc application hosted in Katana
